Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for the price you pay”
Reviews.Author: el_roquero
Reviews.Content: We stayed in LA only for 1 night and this was a great option for the price. The rooms are quite large, I guess LA-size!. The bathroom by itself is almost as large as a hotel room I stayed in during a visit to Rome! Room was relatively clean, no complaints about that. Breakfast was limited, but still OK for a hotel like this. To name all items offered: Bagels, toasts, creals and Milk, buttter, jam, honey, and coffee. Our only complaint was that there was no cheese of any type available. The only negative comment. There was some noise from the neighboring rooms late at night (~3 am), and also early in the morning (~6 am). I always carry my earplugs when I travel, so the noise was not a major issue. BTW, I rated 'Service' as Average above, since we did not ask for any particular service. We only talked briefly to the staff at check in, breakfast, and check out, and they sounded reasonably polite each time.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfy”
Reviews.Author: topmomma
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and comfortable.. a little dated, but thats expected for the price. The parking lot is small and hard to park if you have any larger than a compact car.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Beware of BED BUG”
Reviews.Author: Beth Y
Reviews.Content: Once we pulled into the parking lot, we didn't feel safe already. Almost canceled the reservation, but the policy from hotels.com no refundable. Ground floor is noisy, you could hear the upstairs. Breakfast is very limited. TV's remote not working. Carpet is so dirty and sticky. And the Highlight from the stay is BED BUG, people! Never ever go back. I wish could give a 0 star!!

Reviews.Title: “Good budget conscious accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Bigskyguy71
Reviews.Content: This motel was the closest to our destination in South Pasadena, and was also on the low cost end of the spectrum. The neighborhood is on the edge of El Serrino which may look a little dicey, but we were pleasantly surprised and felt secure in the the property. It is set up in a fort style with one entry -- a two story building surrounding the parking lot. The staff was friendly. We opted for the king size bed, which was very comfortable, but tight for the room. The facility is definitely older, but had fresh paint outside, upgraded tile in the bathroom adn was clean. There was also a microwave and small refrigerator. We were on the upper floor, which was quiet. There was also a walk in closet, The heater was a little noisey during the night, but an adjustment on the dial set that right. The continental breakfast was modest, but adequate, with cereal, instant oatmeal, muffins and danish, eggo waffles, toast and juice -- no fruit. We stayed three nights, and slept well all three nights. It was not fancy, but was secure and comfortable, plus we loved the money we saved over other options.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and clean room”
Reviews.Author: autumn1010
Reviews.Content: When I drove up to the hotel, I was a little concerned about the outside appearance. Pulling into the lot, I saw that there were families staying here and license plates from all around the country. That made me feel better. The man who checked me in was very friendly and kind. He gave me great suggestions to good places to eat in the area. Later that night I had the best tacos that I've ever had....thanks to his recommendation. The room was updated and clean. No funny smells and the bathroom was immaculate. I was travelling alone and yet I felt safe here. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “amazing value! completely safe and convenient”
Reviews.Author: vonschwind
Reviews.Content: I needed a dirt-cheap hotel in LA for two nights, and this place was amazing. So much better than the luxury hotel where I stayed for two nights (immediately after, on someone else's dime). Easy to find-- neighborhood looks sketchy, but had no problems. Very central to the things I needed to do (in Pasadena, Silverlake, Hollywood, and Downtown). Free parking! The manager was extremely courteous and friendly when I arrived. The room was huge and clean enough-- a few stains on the carpet, but no more than in my own living room. Mini-fridge in the room, free internet. I could hear some noise from neighboring rooms from time to time (folks above having sex), but nothing I haven't heard just as often in fancier places. Great breakfast for free in the mornings, lots of choices (cereal, pastries, fruit, juice, etc.). I opted to carry my food back to my room, rather than eat in the lobby. Check-out was very easy. Overall, I would definitely stay here again, especially at the amazing price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet place”
Reviews.Author: h3ro_me
Reviews.Content: I was there attending a concert, and had issued, getting a room. I stayed one night there. They didn't fussed over the fact that I didn't check out til later. I was just disappointmened that the location was really far from L.A. itself. But other than that, it was a nice and quiet place.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, clean and affordable!”
Reviews.Author: sisterb14
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in order to visit family - for three nights. The manager was welcoming and polite - the room was clean, had a refrigerator and microwave and housekeepers were meticulous! I was very impressed with this facility and would recommend it to anyone looking for a reasonable price, a safe facility with a more than adequate breakfast, too. The beds were comfortable - AC excellent - I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable motel for budget travelers”
Reviews.Author: PULAOKHAO
Reviews.Content: I paid $130 including tax for two nights for a nonrefundable, non-changeable reservation with full payment made about two months in advance. Since I charged it to Discover card when they were offering 5% cashback for travel and made the reservation from hotels.com [preferred online partner] through the discover card website, I got an additional about 4% cashback from Discover card. So I ended up paying net about $118 including tax, which is a decent deal for LA where hotels tend to be expensive and this rate included a free, basic breakfast. As others have pointed out, parking space is tight and entry is narrow so drive carefully. Hotel was only about half full so I did not have parking problem This is an older property so come with realistic expectations. The mattress was somewhat saggy, and as several others have pointed out, the carpet is old and dingy. The rooms and bathrooms are small but sink is outside bathroom so if there are two of you, that may be convenient. The bathroom tile and bathtub seem to be redone recently but the water control for shower head is finicky going from hot to cold very quickly. Hotel only provides soap, shampoo and towels so bring other toiletries. Old CRT TV but reasonably large size squeezed in corner; good part is about 66 cable channels including HBO As Super8 website says, every room has old fridge and old microwave but they worked fine. The furniture [table, chairs, dresser] are old and rather dingy but worked OK. Window AC unit seems new and worked fine without excessive noise. Sink had one blown light bulb but I got a new one from reception. One lamp above dresser did not work. Manager lives onsite and was friendly, cooperative and helpful with directions as was the receptionist. I asked for room not on Huntington Dr or Poplar so would not be disturbed by traffic noise and manager cheerfully and readily accommodated me. Basic breakfast with bread, two types of cereal, muffins, danish, coffee, orange juice, milk. Frozen waffles on Saturday but not on Friday. Area around motel did not seem very safe so be careful after dark Gas station opposite motel Has WIFI but I did not use; has computer with internet connection in lobby [$5/hour] All in all, this is a reasonable choice for those on a limited budget. I stayed here mainly for the location, which is not too far from Pasadena.

Reviews.Title: “just basic, just enough for keeping a roof over your head in the night”
Reviews.Author: roadcrazy1980
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend trip to LA. Location: Kind of ok ... right on the LA Metro/Bus route, I think the stop is right next to the hotel. For driving, it is kind of funny location ... Make sure you take 10/710 to reach the hotel than what your GPS or Google maps may tell you. Rooms: Not noisy, basic, little cramped bath, kind of dirty floor carpet, very small closet, spacious bed and spacious room. Microwave and fridge nice additions. Old CRT 25" tv, works ok Breakfast: very basic, just cereal, coffee, pastry, frozen waffles. internet: no wireless .. make sure to ask the hotel manager to give you a cable. Very SLOWWWWWWWW ... very small parking spaces, as with the rest of LA neighborhood ... average, maybe need to be careful after dark

Reviews.Title: “Better than some expensive downtown Los Angeles hotels”
Reviews.Author: dragonflynda
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on an extended basis. The staff are very friendly, the room I have been in is a true handicap accessible room in every way -- I have never found it to be the case in ANY hotel. The room seems to be recently updated and is clean. Fridge, microwave, coffee maker, tv, etc. The cons: noisy area and people for whatever reason like to be loud outside all night. Tight parking spaces. The entrance driveway is not a true 2 way so be careful entering and exiting. The morning food selection is better than nothing but not a lot. Pros: short distance from Los Angeles downtown area and to Pasadena. If you take Poplar Blvd all the way to Freemont St and beyond, you will hit the area with restaurants and stores on Freemont etc. You can ask for discounted rate for extended stay and AARP.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: Roger6
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at this particular motel. Staff were incredibly nice, helped us out with locations to visit and directions as such. Room were a decent size, which was nice and clean. The room comes with a small refrigerator and microwave. Internet is free in the rooms but is an Ethernet connection (a staff member brought the cable to our room and even setup our laptop), a computer is available to be used in the lobby but is charged. All in all, a very nice place, would recommend it to everyone. By the way, check in early so the staff can readjust your room to your preference.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad placa at all”
Reviews.Author: GarethClayton
Reviews.Content: Family of five from the UK looking for somewhere to stay in order to visit Hollywood. Didn't arrive there until late on and the receptionist waited for us to make sure we were OK. He was very polite and helpful. The rooms were spacious and clean and we couldn't fault the place. Breakfast room was fairly small but caused no problems. We would have no hesitation in staying there again but again bear in mind that as always you get what you pay for. If you want 5 star then book 5 star. For us just wanting a clean room for the two nights we were there while we toured around, it was more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Pride of the Motel Chain”
Reviews.Author: DrRingDing
Reviews.Content: I had an uneventful stay here in mid-May, 2008. The advantages of the motel are a decent array of breakfast food and drink options, and its location on a main thoroughfare close to Pasadena. The disavantages are that the high-speed internet access is not wireless, but rather is BYOEC (Bring Your Own Ethernet Cable), and the poor condition of the bathroom (see photos). This motel is labeled the 'Pride of the Motel Chain,' but isn't one to brag about.

Reviews.Title: “Me gusta Super 8”
Reviews.Author: themaudesquad
Reviews.Content: They were remodelling the hotel that we had planned to stay. Instead of listening to hammers and saws all night we chose Super 8 to save our vacation. The room was clean and quite. No strange odors. The air conditioning worked. The room had a little refrigerator and microwave. They even supplied us with plenty of little soaps and little plastic drinking cups. What more could you ask for! The only negative is that one of the days somehow the maid skipped our room and our beds were left unmade and we missed out on getting clean towels. Nothing spectacular, just a decent room... which was exactly what we were looking for!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Convenient Location & Pet-Friendly in Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: maryellen1952
Reviews.Content: I stay at this motel for 3 night while looking for an apartment in Los Angeles with my 3 small dogs. This is a great place for the person who spends their $$$ on other things rather than a luxurious room. There is an adeqate Continental breakfast buffet as well as in-room internet connection. This place is one o the most reasonably-priced pet-friendly accommodations in the L.A. area. This is one of the East Los Angeles neighborhoods comprised of Latino/Asian/Caucasian so it has a unique character. There are great Mexican restaurants around the motel. Many families seem to stay here so it's probably not the quietest place however the price and location negate that. It seems many people stay here when having medical tests/treatment done at UCLA Medical Center. A short distance is the Alhambra downtown area with a Target store as well as movie theatres and good choice of restaurants. Staff was helpful and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “A fine, cheap place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Awarely
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our stay in this clean, comfortable, and convenient location for four nights. The floorplan of the room was a bit odd, but non-smoking meant non-smoking (unlike some other motels where we have stayed) and the price was right. The neighborhood seemed a bit unsafe and I would not recommend walking the streets after dark, but security was fine as far as we could tell and we had no incidents. The parking lot is within a courtyard formed by the wings of the motel and for cheap, nights-only sleeping accomodations, all was well. We did not try the continental breakfast, preferring to keep fruit in the fridge. The location was convenient to I-5 and Pasadena (and of course San Marino and the Huntington Library and Museum), as well as the northeast part of L.A. (Stay at the Spring Hill Suites in Manhattan Beach if you want to be near the airport or explore the southwest part of L.A. --Hawthorne, Long Beach, etc.) We loved the free high speed internet (not wireless) in the room and the mini refrigerator with icebox! The usual toiletries and towels were provided, although our desk lacked a chair for some strange reason. All in all, a fine experience and we definitely would stay here again if we need a low-end comfortable place to sleep in L.A.

Reviews.Title: “great value for price”
Reviews.Author: gotya7
Reviews.Content: Great place only 10 minutes from downtown.Comfortable rooms with very friendly staff went out of the way to help me with directions.

Reviews.Title: “What a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin... 1. The room had a hole in one wall; you could see outside, people could see inside, and bugs could come in and out. I told the woman at the front desk that there was hole all the way through the wall. She responded, “I know, all the rooms are like that. We’re getting internet.” I asked her, “Well, we’re in the room right now, what can you do about it?” She said, “Here, stick this in it.” And handed me a washcloth. 2. Inside the room graffiti was carved into all of the light fixtures, the air conditioning unit, and into the wooden furniture. 3. The bathroom door had what looked like dried food all over it. The bathroom fixtures were rusted and the floor was incredibly sticky both days we were there. 4. The carpet was filthy and literally turned the bottom of our socks black. We ended up wearing shoes the entire time we were there and would not walk on the carpet. 5. The sheets were clean but the top sheet had a blood stain towards the top and in a visible location. We were given clean sheets but were still disgusted by the stain. 6. All of the walls were filthy, the furniture didn’t match, the bottom of one of the chairs was ripped and sagging to the ground, the refrigerator never cooled enough to keep our food from spoiling., most of the TV stations did not get good reception, and all of the furniture looked like it came from a thrift store. 7. We had been gone all day the second day we were there. We arrived at the hotel room around 3pm, hot, tired, and in need of a shower. I went to take a shower and discovered there were no towels. I asked the housekeeper in the next room where the towels were. She did not speak one word of English so I went to the front desk, inquired about the towels, and was told by the woman at the front desk, “The towels are in the wash.” I said, “All of the towels are in the wash? Don’t you have any extras?” She said there were no extra towels. I asked when they would be ready, to which she replied, “They’re in the wash now so whenever they’re done we’ll put them in the dryer and when they’re done in the dryer they’ll be ready.” 8. The continental breakfast was OK. The only problems with the breakfast was: long black hairs all over the apples and their idea of breakfast, which on Sunday consisted of Twinkies and Ding Dongs. 9. We were told when making the reservation that the rooms all had hair dryers, iron, and ironing board. Our room had NOTHING! 10. There was a homeless lady with a shopping cart “living” in one of the parking spaces. 11. One of the housekeepers was washing the sidewalk and sprayed the entire back of our car, which we had just had washed and detailed, with water. We couldn’t believe it when we saw her do it. We tried to say something to her but she couldn’t speak any English.

HotelInfo.Name: Super 8 Los Angeles / Alhambra
HotelInfo.Address: 5350 S Huntington Drive, Poplar & Huntington Drive South, Los Angeles, CA 90032
